head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: White Plains: Indian Point Power Plant Survey

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: White Plains: Indian Point Power Plant Survey

body.head.byline: By Lisa W. Foderaro (NYT) (Compiled by Anthony Ramirez)

abstract.p: Andrew M Cuomo, Democratic candidate for governor, says that spot survey in Westchester County by his campaign shows that potassium iodide pills, useful for combating thyroid cancer after nuclear accident, are difficult to find there (S)

block.p: Andrew M. Cuomo, a Democratic candidate for governor, said yesterday that a spot survey in Westchester County by his campaign showed that potassium iodide pills, useful for combating thyroid cancer after a nuclear accident, are difficult to find there. The county has begun distributing free pills to residents within a 10-mile radius of the Indian Point nuclear power plant, and has publicized a list of pharmacies that have agreed to carry the pills. But Mr. Cuomo said a check of 40 pharmacies within the same radius found that 95 percent of them did not stock the pills.
